meanings.definition: Bullying or harassing someone with persistent demands or threats.
meanings.sent1: The hectoring of the smaller kids on the playground was unacceptable.
meanings.sent2: The hectoring from the boss made the employees feel intimidated.
meanings.sent3: The hectoring of the cat by the playful puppy led to a funny chase around the house.
meanings.sent4: The hectoring of the wind against the fragile tree branches sounded like a fierce argument.
meanings.sent5: The hectoring of the storm outside made it impossible to sleep peacefully.

meanings.definition: Speaking to someone in a loud, forceful, or aggressive manner.
meanings.sent1: The hectoring tone of the coach motivated the team to push harder.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't stand his hectoring voice during the argument.
meanings.sent3: The hectoring sound of the alarm clock in the morning was enough to wake up the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The hectoring roar of the lion echoed through the jungle, signaling its dominance.
meanings.sent5: His hectoring speech at the rally stirred up strong emotions in the crowd.
